title: Consider this your permission slip to stay in
author: Zipporah Osei
bullets: Things to Do Everything you need to stay warm, entertained, and well-fed at home.
By Zipporah Osei January 23, 2026 | 1:17 PM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
If snow, ice, or bitter cold have you eyeing the couch instead of the door, we’ve got you covered.

title: Prosecutors say Plymouth woman staged cancer diagnosis and her own death to skip court
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News An investigation found that Wilson forged healthcare, hospice, and funeral home documents — plus a death certificate — to avoid court hearings.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Prosecutors are accusing a Plymouth woman of faking a terminal cancer diagnosis — and even her own death — to dodge a series of court hearings, according to the Plymouth District Attorney’s office.

title: The love stories we leave behind at restaurants
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters Plus: A B-Side and Love Letters dating event is happening next month.
Dugout Cafe, a historic dive bar open on Commonwealth Avenue since 1934, is closing and has sold its liquor license to Earl's Kitchen and Bar, a chain of upscale restaurants.
Suzanne Kreiter/Globe Staff ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Marblehead company launches limited-run ‘Wake With Drake’ coffee
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News Neighbors Chris Buchanan and Adam Questad combined their love of coffee and the Patriots into a playoff-inspired release.
Limited-run "Wake with Drake" coffee from Bond Coffee Roasters in Marblehead.

(Photo courtesy of Chris Buchanan) By Annie Jonas January 23, 2026 | 10:00 AM 2 minutes to read With the Patriots riding a resurgence under first-year head coach Mike Vrabel and quarterback Drake Maye leading them into Sunday’s AFC Championship game against the Denver Broncos, two lifelong fans from Marblehead found an unexpected way to package their excitement: coffee.

title: WEEI to cease broadcasting on 103.7 in Southeastern Mass. and R.I.
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Media The sports radio station will still be available on 93.
7 FM in Boston, and the company that owns it will find a new signal in the Rhode Island market.
WEEI will remain on 93.

title: Public urged to report sightings of entangled right whale
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Environment The Center for Coastal Studies' Marine Animal Entanglement Response team is continuing efforts after responding last weekend in Cape Cod Bay.
The Center for Coastal Studies is asking the public to help locate an entangled North Atlantic right whale.

Center for Coastal Studies RIGHT WHALES: The Center for Coastal Studies is asking the public to help locate an entangled North Atlantic right whale after its Marine Animal Entanglement Response team responded to the animal over the weekend, according to a statement from CCS.
